definition: (category defined by the Communist Party) poor and lower-middle peasants: farmers who, before land reform, possessed little or no land (poor peasants) and those who were barely able to support themselves with their own land (lower-middle peasants)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: They classed as poor and lower-middle peasants at the time of the land reform.
sentences.chinese: 土地改革时他们被划为贫下中农。

sentences.english: Then a representative of the poor and lower middle class peasants would give us a report, telling of his miserable life before liberation.
sentences.chinese: 请来贫下中农的代表作报告，诉说解放前的苦难生活。

definition: to work in the fields (esp. young school-leavers)/forced agricultural experience for city intellectuals
stinking intellectual (contemptuous term for educated people during the Cultural Revolution)
educated youth (sent to work in farms during the Cultural Revolution)
land reform/same as 土地改革[tu3 di4 gai3 ge2]
rich peasant/social class of people farming their own land, intermediate between land-owner class 地主[di4 zhu3] and poor peasant 貧農|贫农[pin2 nong2]
capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
social composition/social status (in Marxist theory, esp. using during the Cultural Revolution)
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
fixing of farm output quotas for each household
